title: Cosmetic cleanup of generated Gemfile
body:
- Remove obsolete/misleading comment about assets only being used production
- Remove unnecessary group :assets
- Eliminate blank lines if options[:skip_javascript] is not specified

title: entirelyby => 'entirely by'
Changed if ! to unless
body: Changed if ! to unless for more readability

change `!true` to `unless`
body: Change condition to use unless instead

title: drop errors constant
body: Drop unnecessary constant creation

title: mention strong parameters in complex forms section of the guides.
body:
Closes #9921.

Document the usage of strong params in the context of a nested form.

title: `#determine_constant_from_test_name` does not swallow NoMethodErrors.
body:
Closes #9933.

Since `NoMethodError` is a subclass of `NameError` determining
the constant from a test name silently swalled them.

title: drop variable assignment in validations
body: Remove extra variable assignment in validations

title: Add support for FULLTEXT and SPATIAL indexes using the :type flag for MySQL
body:
This is a rebase of #8430.

The bulk of the changes as a result of #9891 no longer are needed to support the using index flag, except for dumping the `using` in the schema, which I had in my last pull request so I left it in.  

This pull request is a pure rebase of #8430, if you want me to break this up so dumping the `using` in the schema is a separate pull request, I can do that, just let me know.

body: This fixes the backport PR #9899 causing test failures on 1.8.7.

title: Fix STI descentants by constantizing models
body:
Assume we've got three models:
```
class Payment < ActiveRecord::Base
class CardPayment < Payment
class CreditCardPayment < CardPayment
```

Assume that at least one CreditCardPayment have been added to database.

Run console:
```
>> CardPayment.last
  CardPayment Load (0.2ms)  SELECT "payments".* FROM "payments" WHERE "payments"."type" IN ('CardPayment') ORDER BY "payments"."id" DESC LIMIT 1
=> nil
>> CardPayment.descendants
=> []
>> CreditCardPayment.last
  CreditCardPayment Load (0.5ms)  SELECT "payments".* FROM "payments" WHERE "payments"."type" IN ('CreditCardPayment') ORDER BY "payments"."id" DESC LIMIT 1
=> #<CreditCardPayment id: 1, type: "CreditCardPayment", created_at: "2013-03-26 15:19:08", updated_at: "2013-03-26 15:19:08">
>> CardPayment.descendants
=> [CreditCardPayment(id: integer, type: string, created_at: datetime, updated_at: datetime)]

```

So the middle sti model `CardPayment` does not have descendants till `CreditCardPayment` will be called. Problem is fixed when preloaded , what do you think?

title: routing bugfixes when matching multiple paths
body:
#### 1.) multiple paths containing a slash

This is basically a revert of https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/d03aa104e069be4e301efa8cefb90a2a785a7bff and a new fix inside the `#match` method.

#### 2.) multiple paths using the match shorthand syntax

As the `#match` must be aware of multiple paths the shorthand expansion must be applied for each path separately.

title: Bump TZInfo version to 0.3.37 based on version v2013b of the underlying tz data.
body: This gem is `data` gem. Thus I guess we should use latest version.

title: current_scope is not applied for subclasses
body:
#9869 

The fix is causing a test failure as of now.

```
NamedScopeTest#test_should_not_duplicates_where_values 
[/Users/nsingh/dev/
rails_edge/rails/activerecord/test/cases/named_scope_test.rb:303]:
Expected: ["1=1"]
  Actual: ["1=1", "1=1"]
```

Even though the test is asserting that where values should not be duplicated, the sql that is generated does not have the duplication. So I'm not sure about the validity of the test.

I'll clean up pull request with squashing, change log etc when it is all set to go.

cc @jonleighton @tenderlove

title: respect auto_increment in rename_column for mysql
body:
Closes #3493

The PR extracts "extra" on mysql column to fetch `auto_increment` information, which is associated with the column.

This information is then used when migrating.

title: fix pg quoting
body: fix pg quoting

title: use relative links inside guides [ci skip]
body: It makes sense to use relative links inside the guides. This way they work locally in the generated output as well as on guide.rubyonrails.org as edgeguide.rubyonrails.org.

title: serializable_hash: Jobs should partially define how to as serialize and de-serialize themselves
body:
(based on feedback from https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/9910)

Problem I'm trying to solve:

Users of Rails Q API expect the Q system to be able to serialize and de-serialize the jobs they enQ.  If it's unable to do so, it should complain about it with an exact reason, at the time of enQ.

My take:

This problem can't easily be solved exclusively by the framework. Any attempt to do so fully would likely lead to a leaky abstraction wherein Job authors end up digging in to the guts of such an implementation.

Instead, a simple and minimal contract should exist between Job objects and the framework responsible for enQ-ing and running them.

1. a run method
2. a serializable_hash method
3. a from_serializable_hash method

Additionally:

Backend job systems should have a choice on how to serialize jobs.  It's fine for Marshal to be the default in Rails, but it's unnecessarily restricting to impose this requirement on all integrators.

title: Adds support for concurrent indexing in PostgreSQL adapter
body:
Can be called via

    add_index(:people, :last_name, :concurrently => true)

title: move mailer testing examples into the testing guide.
body:
Closes #9325.

I adjusted the example and the description in the testing guide and
simply linked from the mailer to the testing guide. This way we don't
have to maintain two separate places.

title: Relaxed jbuilder dependency and bumped version number
body: Newer version contains some generator bugfixes

title: Fix guide and add `app/views/application`into default directory structure along with the current partial template resolving order
body:
Since Rails 3.1, partial template resolver searches also for `app/views/application` directory and it's been the Way, I think.

So I changed as below:

  * The guide explains the resolving order
  * `app/views/application` will be generated by `rails new` command

title: unable to bundle HEAD rails master
body:
Seems to be a problem bundling current rail master (7a32c6300c2b11dc1660338535c653a0132df196)

workaround is removing the arel requirement from Gemfile

seems this is because rails gemspec specified arel and master of arel are incompatible version:

    Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem "arel":
      In Gemfile:
        rails (>= 0) ruby depends on
          arel (~> 3.0.2) ruby

        arel (4.0.0.beta2.20130314230643)

https://github.com/carlhuda/bundler/issues/2419
